info.game_comments:
Kara Spak game 6.

(Oprah Winfrey: Clues about The Oprah Winfrey Show on the next Jeopardy!)

(1, 1).clue: John Quincy Adams called this, which his father signed, "a light of salvation and redemption to the oppressed"

(2, 1).clue: (Oprah reads the clue from a chair.)  I told my audience about the thing I wanted most in my life, the role of Sofia in this movie; the moment I surrendered to the possibility it wouldn't happen was when I got the call from Steven Spielberg

(3, 1).clue: In computers "DOS" can either stand for disk operating system or this type of attack that keeps users from a site

(4, 1).clue: Harker is darker /I'm Transylvania dreamin' /Mina is yummy

(5, 1).clue: (Alex gives the clue from an industry shop-floor in Dearborn, MI.)  This is the only one of America's Big Three automakers that did not get a federal bailout in 2009

(1, 2).clue: In a 1976 Playboy interview, he said, "I've committed adultery in my heart many times"

(2, 2).clue: (Oprah reads the clue from a chair.)  We gave some moms a possibly life-saving aha! moment when we showed how easily kids can be lured by a stranger who asks them to find a lost one of these

(3, 2).clue: Skype uses VoIP, which stands for this "over Internet protocol"

(4, 2).clue: Just like the old man /In that book by Nabokov /Young Dolores Haze

(5, 2).clue: Though it's named for a big state, this firm founded in 1930 makes a lot of tiny electronic stuff

(1, 3).clue: On April 12, 1945 he asked Eleanor Roosevelt, "Is there anything I can do for you?"

(2, 3).clue: (Oprah reads the clue from a chair.)  Several "aha!" moments on the show have come courtesy of this straight-talking Texan, like when he tells people who've been stepped on that "you teach people how to treat you"

(3, 3).clue: You may have noticed the MSG network on your program guide; MSG stands for this New York City locale

(4, 3).clue: Ultra-violence /Burgess hits the ol' milkbar /Ah, dystopia

(5, 3).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew gives the clue from Microsoft's headquarters.)  After Microsoft moved to Bellevue, Washington, this company asked them to write the operating system for their new PC; MS-DOS would soon become an industry standard

(6, 3).clue: A memorable election year: duo milia

(1, 4).clue: Against Bryan's "Cross of Gold" oratory, in 1896 he said, "I am a tariff man standing on a tariff platform"

(2, 4).clue: (Oprah reads the clue from a chair.)  An aha! moment is grasping something for the first time--I could see it in this former "Growing Pains" actress when she realized her drunk driving arrest was a sign she needed to listen to her instincts

(4, 4).clue: London, not England /The ghost dog of the Klondike /Here, Buck!  Speak!  Sit!  Stay!

(5, 4).clue: This cell phone company made the radio that relayed the first words from the moon

(1, 5).clue: In this collection of essays, James Madison wrote, "If men were angels, no government would be necessary"

(2, 5).clue: (Oprah reads the clue from a chair.)  I'd always kept a journal, but often of complaints, not of gratitude; all of that changed for me with this book by Sarah Ban Breathnach

(3, 5).clue: Debate raged in 2009 as to whether members of Congress had been briefed on "EIT"s, enhanced this techniques

(4, 5).clue: Fiver & Bigwig /Tell me about the rabbits /Non-purple Hazel

(5, 5).clue: A statue of the god Mercury inspired the logo of this tire company

(1, 1).clue: An application to a judge to obtain an order; a lawyer might make one to dismiss or to suppress

(3, 1).clue: Between 1892 & 1924 most immigrants to the U.S. came through facilities on this island

(4, 1).clue: An audit of part of a taxpayer's complex records, or a free taste of a drug that doctors give patients

(5, 1).clue: Russian-born Sept. 1849, must love dogs, his name rings a bell, died Feb. 27, 1936

(6, 1).clue: Add a letter to a word meaning "an assembly of witches" & you get this word that describes a hoof

(1, 2).clue: In federal court, as long as you've at least had a hearing before you skip, you can be tried in this Latin way

(2, 2).clue: ...who played Latka on "Taxi" & was portrayed by Jim Carrey on the big screen

(3, 2).clue: This island nation is the only one named for a biblical king

(4, 2).clue: An agreement between a company & an outside auditor is called this, like something ending at the altar

(5, 2).clue: Born May 15, 1859 in Paris, physics was his main (radio)activity, died April 19, 1906

(6, 2).clue: Add a letter to a word for a product of Mount Etna & you get this term describing a very young insect

(1, 3).clue: This type of witness can give testimony no one else can offer, & may be held by the government as a result

(2, 3).clue: ...who hosted the premiere episode of "Saturday Night Live" in 1975

(3, 3).clue: Most of this island was destroyed by a volcanic explosion in August 1883

(4, 3).clue: Children's Benadryl comes in this form, like marketable securities

(5, 3).clue: Jolted to life in Como, Italy Feb. 18, 1745, generated a lot of static, his electricity went out March 5, 1827

(6, 3).clue: Add a letter to a term for a resident of Haifa or Tel Aviv & you get this surname of a former British prime minister

(1, 4).clue: From the Latin for "to bargain", it's an agreement between opposing counsels, like to the admissibility of evidence

(2, 4).clue: ...who provided the voice of Barry B. Benson in "Bee Movie"

(3, 4).clue: Christopher Columbus discovered what is today the island nation of Dominica on this day of the week in Nov. 1493

(4, 4).clue: Accountants try to do this, keep revenue & related expenses in the same time frame; it's also a singles dot-com

(5, 4).clue: Great Dane born Oct. 7, 1885, built atomic models, died Nov. 18, 1962

(6, 4).clue: Add a letter to a Judean military governor's surname & you get this low-impact exercise

(1, 5).clue: At "Law & Order" arraignments, the scumbag's weasel lawyer tries to get bail, while "the people seek" this

(2, 5).clue: ...who's an avid art collector & wrote the play "Picasso at the Lapin Agile"

(3, 5).clue: On January 10 this South Atlantic territory celebrates Margaret Thatcher Day

(4, 5).clue: Some drugs can affect this, the sum of debit entries minus the sum of credit entries in an account

(5, 5).clue: Born in Siberia in 1834, we obey his periodic law, died in 1907 in St. Petersburg

(6, 5).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows a map on the monitor.) Add a letter to a country in Asia & you get this former African capital

(0, 0).clue: In 1998 these 2 baseball rivals shared top honors as Sports Illustrated's Sportsmen of the Year
